show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

And this party is a real beaut, with yuletide props like pine tree air fresheners, Christmas lights necklaces, and shocked cat keychains to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A cheerful celebration with themed games, props & singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

show.title: WWW.RACHELORMONT.COM
show.headline: A searing blast of pop obsession.

show.title: Sense and Sensibility
show.headline: Lose your heart and come to your senses

event.title: <show-title>Sense and Sensibility</show-title> <event-type-title>30th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Fall in love with the Dashwood sisters again
event.description: This December, celebrate the 30th anniversary of SENSE AND SENSIBILITY – back in cinemas and newly remastered in 4K. Directed by Oscar® nominee Ang Lee (CROUCHING TIGER, HIDDEN DRAGON) and adapted by Emma Thompson from Jane Austen’s beloved novel, the film tells the story of the Dashwood sisters: pragmatic Elinor (Thompson) and passionate Marianne (Kate Winslet). After the death of their father, the sisters and their mother are left without inheritance and must navigate love and social standing in a rigid society. Their contrasting journeys – Elinor’s reserved affection for Edward Ferrars (Hugh Grant) and Marianne’s romantic entanglements with Willoughby (Greg Wise) and Colonel Brandon (Alan Rickman) – lead them to balance heart and reason, sense and sensibility.

show.title: Gremlins 2: The New Batch
show.headline: The most joyful monster bash of 1990

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins 2: The New Batch</show-title>
event.headline: The most joyful monster bash of 1990
event.description: No one’s denying that the original GREMLINS is a top-notch holiday monster movie…but I gotta say: GREMLINS 2 takes the Christmas cake and splatters it against the wall. Dante’s long-awaited sequel revives all the man-trampling insanity of the first film, multiplies it by 10,000 and sprinkles it with glowing chunks of sheer chaos. Mogwai-lovin’ gremlin-wreckers Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, and the great Dick Miller are back, now with a front row seat for the creatures’ takeover of a New York City high-rise. The diminutive terror tornadoes have upgraded to go with their fancy new digs, among them a giant tarantula beast, a bookish intellectual, an electricity creature and many, many, MANY more. Terror legend Christopher Lee is on hand to drop some mad science on the wee maniacs, but nothing can slow their absolute ascent into the annals of anarchistic madcappery!

event.title: <show-title>Anaconda (2025)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Alamo becomes the Amazon at this movie party
event.description: Slither into your local Alamo Drafthouse for our exclusive ANACONDA Movie Party, hosted live with interactive props that make you part of the madness. Gear up with a jungle bandana for snake tracking, surprise your friends with a deadly Ana-can-da snake in a can, keep your flashlight keychain close, and watch your stretchy bait bacon. You never know what giant reptiles may show up.

show.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas (2000): 25th Anniversary
show.headline: He puts the mean in green

landscapeHeroImage.altText: DR. SEUSS' HOW THE GRINCH STOLE CHRISTMAS

portraitHeroImage.altText: DR. SEUSS' HOW THE GRINCH STOLE CHRISTMAS

posterImages.altText: HOW THE GRINCH STOLE CHRISTMAS 25th Anniversary

event.title: <show-title>Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas (2000): 25th Anniversary</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Your heart will grow three sizes at our interactive movie party
event.description:
Discover the true meaning of the holiday season with this live-action adaptation of the beloved classic. Why is the Grinch such a grouch? No one seems to know, until little Cindy Lou Who takes matters into her own hands and turns both Whoville and the Grinch's world upside down, inside out…and funny side up.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • A planner – you can't cancel dinner with yourself again!
  • Cheermeister sash – it's your responsibility to spread joy and enthusiasm this holiday season
  • Antler headband – just the thing you need to look like a reindeer
  • A snowflake – like the one on your sleeve

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: All aboard for an interactive holiday adventure the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday movie party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

show.title: Twilight (2008)
show.headline: When you can live forever, what do you live for?

event.title: <show-title>Twilight (2008)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say the name of this impossibly fun & interactive screening out loud…Movie Party
event.description:
You better hold on tight, spider monkey, because we’ve got an interactive screening for you that shines brighter than Edward’s skin on a sunny day.

While that might be the skin of a killer, it’s the face that launched a thousand fans, and we’re bringing as many as we can together for our TWILIGHT Movie Party. Not only will it feature Edward’s steely charisma and maybe the best baseball scene ever put to film, it’ll have themed props like blood vials (mini ketchup bottles), TITSOAK sunglasses to let everyone know that you have the skin of a killer, and an apple stress ball – just don't drop the forbidden fruit unless a vampire is around to catch it).

So start working on your tan, book a flight to Forks, and join us for a night of bloodthirsty fun you’ll remember for the next 100 years of being 17.

show.title: Mystery Machine (12/15/2025)
show.headline: Tempt cinematic fate with the latest new releases

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
show.headline: Forever is only the beginning

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bella's pregnant – help us throw her a movie party baby shower
event.description:
Our TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Party Saga is nearly over with the first chapter of its epic conclusion – BREAKING DAWN PART 1.

Bella has finally chosen between Team Edward and Team Jacob, and after a blending of the vamp and human families, it’s off to the isle of Esme for a honeymoon. Unfortunately, their bliss is short-lived when Bella gets knocked up with a half-vamp, rapidly growing baby – and you thought you were done with newborns after ECLIPSE. Join us as we celebrate the happy couple on their creepy little bundle of joy with themed props like styrofoam cups perfect for that tasty blood babies crave, red glasses that let you look through the eyes of a vampire, and a bridal comb so you have something old and something blue for the wedding.

No measure of time partying with you is enough, but we’ll take all we can get, so book those tickets ASAP. If you don’t, the treaty is totally void, at least in Sam’s mind (that guy can be a real stickler).

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
show.headline: The epic finale that will live forever

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: We've seen your future – it involves you having a blast at this epic movie party
event.description:
After all this time, we finally understand why we’ve been so obsessed with TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Parties. It was this one, BREAKING DAWN PART 2…we imprinted on it and want you to too! It’s a wolf thing, we have no control over it, but that doesn’t mean we can’t still have fun.

The epic conclusion to TWILIGHT sees newly vamped Bella the proud mom of a creepy, rapidly growing, werewolf-imprinted, half-vampire/half-human baby with a totally normal name. The Volturi aren’t too happy about that so the Cullens and their allies will have to prepare for an all-out decapitation fest. Prepare for the final battle with some magnifico-themed props, including some tiny hands that can feel into your mind, a pen and notebook so you can take notes on how to act human, and a film gradient keychain featuring all of the films’ unique color filters.

No one has loved a Movie Party series as much as we love this one (with one exception). We thought it would last forever but forever isn’t as long as we’d hoped, so be sure to book your seats while they last.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
show.headline: It all begins...with a choice

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Eclipse</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do us an extraordinary honor and say yes to this interactive screening
event.description:
Every choice has its consequences, some more than others. For example, if you choose to join us for another interactive TWILIGHT screening, the consequence will be you having an incredible time at the movies.

We’re back for another Movie Party in the perpetually cloudy town of Forks, and we think this one will eclipse all the rest. Edward’s back in town and Bella has a few big decisions to make. Will she go for the muscled-up werewolf she’s known since they were kids, or the immortal 17-year-old asking for her hand in marriage? Either way, we’ve got some themed props that you’re sure to imprint on, including custom-packaged hand warmers (in case you need to hide out on a snowy mountain), a glitter temporary tattoo, a graduation tassel, and Bella’s engagement ring (note: it will be a slightly less valuable recreation).

So book those seats before all the shows get filled with armies of newborns – we promise we won’t steal your reason for existing.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
show.headline: The next chapter begins

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: New Moon</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say hello to Jacob's biceps in this lovesick interactive screening
event.description:
No need to throw yourself off a cliff hoping to get a glimpse of Movie Party fun, because we’re back from Italy with another interactive TWILIGHT screening.

It’s a whole NEW MOON this time around. Edward’s gone, Jacob hit puberty in a big way, and Bella has a serious case of separation anxiety. The only thing that hasn’t changed is how much fun you’ll have. You give us everything we need just by breathing, but we’re giving all of you some themed gifts like a La Push bumper sticker as a keepsake to remember where you've been, mini desk calendars, and custom bandaids. Be sure to keep that last one handy for papercuts at family gatherings.

So whether you’re Team Edward or Team Jacob, hop on your motorcycle and join us for another adventure in Forks that’s...kind of beautiful.

show.title: Black Christmas '74 + The Occupant of the Room
show.headline: A double dose of Canadian horror excellence.

event.title: <show-title>Black Christmas '74 + The Occupant of the Room</show-title>
event.headline: A double dose of Canadian horror excellence.
event.description:
About THE OCCUPANT OF THE ROOM
A schoolteacher’s late-night arrival at a hotel in the Alps without a reservation leaves him with no option but to accept the room of a missing hotel guest — leading to a sleepless night full of strange and uncanny occurrences. The narrative debut of Kier-La Janisse, director of the SXSW award-winning documentary Woodlands Dark and Days Bewitched: A History of Folk Horror, and author of the pioneering horror memoir House of Psychotic Women, is based on the classic chiller of the same name by Algernon Blackwood.

DCP courtesy of Severin Films

About BLACK CHRISTMAS
Holiday movies are sentimental and uplifting, but surprisingly devoid of knife murders. BLACK CHRISTMAS—one of the most influential Hitchcockian slashers of all time—is here to help. When sorority sisters Olivia Hussey, Margot Kidder (SUPERMAN), and Andrea Martin find themselves under attack from a foul-mouthed killer, it’s up to police chief John Saxon (A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET) to even the odds. But what about Keir Dullea (2001: A SPACE ODYSSEY), the brooding art-school pianist? Could he have something to do with the mutilation rampage? BLACK CHRISTMAS is a terrifying and demented holiday tradition that gets everything right. We’d expect nothing less from Bob Clark, the pioneering director of A CHRISTMAS STORY.

4k DCP courtesy of Shout! Factory and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: The Doors: When You're Strange
show.headline: 4K restoration in theaters for the first time for the band's 60th anniversary

show.title: Saturday Night Fever
show.headline: The fantasy adventure of 1977.

event.title: <show-title>Saturday Night Fever</show-title>
event.headline: Programmed by Josh Safdie ahead of his latest, MARTY SUPREME
event.description:
SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER is presented as part of our Josh Safdie Guest Select for his new film, MARTY SUPREME.

“He’s the king out there, Father!”

Every weekend at 2001 Space Odyssey (that’s [the] fucking name of the night club!), a small discotheque on the periphery of Brooklyn, Tony Manero is the biggest star you can imagine. He’s a dancer in tune with pure soul, just iconic. He’s got a talent no one seems to respect, certainly not his family who just want him to take his job at the paint store seriously. He’s a great salesman, but he spends all his money on rayon shirts that’ll look perfect hovering over the glowing glass brick floor at 2001. Travolta does the impossible (back then) of transcending the stardom of the small screen by exploding as Tony on the big screen. He plays him like a TV star, all penned in yearning for more... with the type of naive iconography that’s only achievable through an insulated confidence. The camera glides, Travolta truly shines a cosmic dancer and The Bee Gees provide a perfect sonic soundscape for escapism. Get high and dance because life is hard. What does that star look like when not in Bay Ridge, when he’s humbled by the real world? and what does a trophy outside the odyssey get you? (Josh Safdie)

4k DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

show.title: The Long Kiss Goodnight
show.headline: Geena Davis' amnesiac sleeper agent rages through Christmas

event.title: <show-title>The Long Kiss Goodnight</show-title>
event.headline: Geena Davis and Samuel Jackson in Renny Harlin’s explosive holiday masterpiece!
event.description:
Preceded by an introduction/comic lecture by performer Micheal Foulk

“Chefs do that.”

There are a lot of arguments around whether or not DIE HARD or GREMLINS are Christmas movies, and honestly, I don’t care. They’re both great cinema experiences, but for this homosexual film lover, the most essential action-packed holiday movie is Renny Harlin and Shane Black’s THE LONG KISS GOODNIGHT! And boy, is this ever a Shane Black script. Fans of KISS KISS BANG BANG and LAST ACTION HERO will immediately recognize Black’s signature brand of “gee shucks, ain’t I a stinker?” sexism and cartoonishly heightened I-don’t-give-a-fuck “coolness.” And the plot? Perfectly ridiculous. Exceptionally '90s. Recovering amnesiac schoolteacher Samantha Caine (the icon Geena Davis) is happy leading a modest life, raising her daughter upstate in Pennsylvania with her safe, milquetoast boyfriend, Hal. After an unfortunate head injury, Samantha begins to experience flashes of her past life as *GASP* Charlie Baltimore, a presumed dead cutthroat bottle blonde assassin with ties to the worst parts of the underworld. To understand her clandestine history and protect her family, Samantha enlists the aid of low-rent P.I. Mitch Hennessey (pitch-perfect, classic Samuel L. Jackson).

Can Samantha and Mitch survive this deadly web of geopolitical intrigue? Or will the ghosts of Charlie’s past finally catch up to her and finish her off? Burning with fractured masculinity, exploding with cattywampus gender roles, and riddled with questions of identity and presentation, THE LONG KISS GOODNIGHT is the perfect film to close out this year of Queer Film Theory 101. And remember what Charlie always says: "Life is pain. Get used to it."

show.title: Megalopolis
show.headline: Francis Ford Coppola & Adam Driver build a better future

event.title: <show-title>Megalopolis</show-title> <event-type-title>New Year's Day Celebration</event-type-title>
event.headline: Pre-recorded Q&A with Francis Ford Coppola
event.description:
Featuring a pre-recorded Q&A with filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola

Like the famed empire that Francis Ford Coppola’s epic passion project is styled after, MEGALOPOLIS is a towering, monumental spectacle that most people will think about at least once a day. The City of New Rome is at a crossroads. At one end sits Cesar Catilina (Adam Driver), the idealistic artist striving for a utopian future, and at the other sits Mayor Franklin Cicero (Giancarlo Esposito), a powerful figure perpetuating greed, special interests, and partisan warfare. Their titanic struggle will shake the foundations of their city and lay the groundwork for a new tomorrow.

As engrossing and ambitious as you would expect from the filmmaker behind THE GODFATHER and APOCALYPSE NOW, MEGALOPOLIS is an unforgettable vision that could only have come from Coppola. Of course, he didn’t do it alone, and everyone in the unbelievable cast (including Driver, Esposito, Nathalie Emmanuel, Aubrey Plaza, Laurence Fishburne, and more) delivers some of the most memorable performances of their careers.

show.title: Maniac Cop 2
show.headline: You have the right to remain silent forever ... again!

event.title: <show-title>Maniac Cop 2</show-title>
event.headline: You have the right remain silent... forever!
event.description:
Picking up directly where MANIAC COP left off, MANIAC COP 2 is a testament to sequels that pull out all stops to be bigger, better and include far more explosions than the first film. Featuring dynamic stunt work - including death defyiing vehicle stunts on the streets of NYC - usually reserved for big budget action fare, MANIAC COP 2 is a true action/horror hybrid and may be the most ridiculous sequel of 1990 - a year which also gave us NO RETREAT, NO SURRENDER 3: BLOOD BROTHERS and TROLL 2.

4k DCP courtesy of Blue Underground.

show.title: The Cat
show.headline: A cosmic rampager from Hong Kong

event.title: <show-title>The Cat</show-title>
event.headline: A cosmic rampager from Hong Kong.
event.description:
Screening the restoration in Cantonese with English subtitles.

This is what happens when a cat saves the planet from an extraterrestrial demon. Blasting from the subconscious of director Ngai Choi Lam (RIKI-OH: THE STORY OF RICKY), THE CAT is one of the most ambitious, inscrutable, and mind-blowing horror movies to ever escape from Hong Kong. Featuring an overdose of acid-drenched creature effects, stop motion hallucinations, and the greatest cat-vs-dog fight ever committed to film, this movie will undoubtedly change everything you thought you knew about cats from outer space. Strap in.

show.title: Matinee
show.headline: Lawrence Woolsey presents the end of civilization as we know it

event.title: <show-title>Matinee</show-title>
event.headline: Lawrence Woolsey presents the end of civilization as we know it.
event.description:
Joe Dante's love letter to the William Castle-era of cinema gimmicks is also a sincere coming-of-age film with the Cuban Missile Crisis as a backdrop. Filled with and fueled by references and in-jokes to B-movies of the 1950s, and featuring a group of young actors performing alongside John Goodman (as a scenery- and cigar-chewing Castle-esque director), MATINEE is Dante's masterpiece, serving as an ode to what it means to be young in a time of crisis and how movies can be the perfect, necessary escape. Watching it just might make you feel (or wish to be) young again.

4k DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: Don't Open Till Christmas
show.headline: A psychopath has it out for anyone dressed like Santa Claus

event.title: <show-title>Don't Open Till Christmas</show-title>
event.headline: A psychopath has it out for anyone dressed like Santa Claus
event.description:
Whatever you do, DON'T OPEN TILL CHRISTMAS. An unsung 1980s holiday slayride from the makers of PIECES, this unhinged slasher follows a psychopath as they slaughter anyone who's unlucky enough to be dressed like Santa Claus during the holiday season. The twisted maniac dishes out stabbings, gunshots, a castration (!), and even burns the face of a poor Saint Nick while he's roasting chestnuts. A fascinating and endlessly entertaining sleazefest, DON'T OPEN TILL CHRISTMAS is infamous for its shocking gore scenes and gratuitous synth-jam performance from horror icon Caroline Munro (DRACULA A.D. 1972, MANIAC). Newly restored from the original 35mm camera negative!

DCP courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: For all ages shows, we welcome babies and kids of all ages. The no talking rules are relaxed, since kids will be kids. But other than that, you can expect the full Alamo experience.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
